intro: Sericocalyx celebicus var. caudatus, commonly known as the long-tailed sericocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers that are often accompanied by bracts resembling leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species in botanical studies of Southeast Asian flora.
